__data__.text:
NEW SUPERANNUATION SCHEME – (FAQ) 
1. What is the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o The New Superannuation Scheme is a retirement benefit plan designed to provide 
financial security to the employee post-retirement. 
2. Who is eligible to join the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o All on -roll employees of Tata AIA Life Insurance Co. Ltd. who hold the position of 
Manager or above are eligible to enrol in the New Superannuation Scheme. 
3. How can an employee enrol in the scheme? 
o An Employee can enrol in the scheme through PeopleStrong System under the Flexi 
Plan. 
4. What is the yearly contribution rate for the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o The yearly contribution rate is 15% of the basic salary, with a maximum limit of ₹1 
lakh. 
5. Will an employee receive income tax benefits if they opt for the Superannuation Scheme? 
o Yes, employees will receive income tax benefits under both the old and new tax 
regimes. The contributions made by the employer to the Superannuation Scheme are 
considered employer contributions, which help reduce the employee's gross taxable 
income. Employer contributions up to INR 1 lakh per annum are tax-exempt. 
6. How does a superannuation scheme work? 
o Individuals contribute a portion of their income to their superannuation fund, which 
is then invested in various assets such as stocks, bonds, and property. Over a period, 
these investments grow, providing a source of income in retirement. 
7. Why is it important to have a superannuation scheme? 
o A superannuation scheme helps individuals save for retirement, ensuring financial 
security and independence during their non-working years. 
8. What are the benefits of contributing to a superannuation scheme? 
o Contributing to a superannuation scheme allows individuals to accumulate savings 
over their working years, benefit from potential tax advantages, and ultimately enjoy 
a comfortable retirement. 
9. What happens to the funds of existing employees in the old Superannuation Scheme? 
o The funds of existing employees will be transferred to the New Superannuation 
Scheme.

10. Are existing employees have been automatically moved to the New Superannuation 
Scheme? 
o Yes, existing employees who are part of the old Superannuation Scheme have been 
already part of the New Superannuation Scheme by default. 
11. Can I opt out of the New Superannuation Scheme once I have joined? 
o No, once you have opted into the New Superannuation Scheme, you cannot opt out. 
12. How can I track my contributions to the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o You will receive a statement on a quarterly basis from the HR Compensation & Benefit 
team. 
13. What happens to my contributions if I leave the company before retirement? 
o Your fund will remain with us till retirement or 
o You can shift to new employer, if they have an approved superannuation scheme  
which has power to except such transfer or 
o In case of ill-health or incapacitation or if he retired from service 10 year before normal 
retirement age, the pension as may be elected by him, will become payable 
immediately. Alternatively, member may elect to defer elect of receipt of pension until 
retirement date. Any death during the deferment period, beneficiary will start getting 
pension on immediate basis. 
14. How can I withdraw funds from the New Superannuation Scheme post-retirement? 
o You can withdraw one-third (if tenure is 5 years or more) or half (if tenure is less than 
5 years) of the total fund value, with a 31.2% TDS applied to the withdrawal amount. 
The remaining fund can be invested in an annuity scheme with TATA AIA (minimum 
age 45 years) or any other annuity scheme provider. 
15. How is the fund managed in the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o The new superannuation scheme is Unit linked with a default option of 10% equity 
and 90% Debt. You may choose to switch investment option any time by writing to HR 
Compensation and Benefit team.

16. What investment options are available within the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o The scheme offers various investment options, including equity, debt, and mix of 
equity and debt funds as mentioned below.

17. Can I change my investment options in the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o Yes, you can switch to different fund option as per your need and risk appetite. 
18. What are the fund management charges for these investment options? 
o The fund management charges range per annum from 0.30% to 1.35%, 
depending on the total fund available under management. 
19. What happens to my superannuation fund if I pass away before retirement? 
o Nominee will start getting pension or they can withdraw the money subject to tax 
applicability. 
20. Can my beneficiaries access my superannuation fund if I pass away? 
o Yes, as per scheme rule. 
21. Can I transfer my superannuation fund to another scheme or provider? 
o Yes, you can transfer your superannuation fund only to another scheme or provider if 
your new organisation offers superannuation benefit to their employees  and have a 
power to except such transfer.

22. What documentation is required to join the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o Employee will not require any document to join the New Superannuation Scheme. 
23. What is the process for nominating a beneficiary? 
o You can nominate a beneficiary by filling out a nomination form and submitting it to 
the HR Department as per scheme rule. 
24. Can I nominate more than one beneficiary for my superannuation fund? 
o Yes, an employee can nominate multiple beneficiaries for their superannuation fund 
according to the scheme rules. For example, an employee can designate 50% to their 
daughter and 50% to their spouse. 
 
25. What happens if I do not nominate a beneficiary? 
o In case of such scenario, on event of death, the money will be paid to legal heir 
appointed by court of law, as per the scheme rule. 
26. What is the minimum age for retirement under the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o The minimum retirement age is typically 60 years, but this may vary based on the 
scheme’s rules. 
27. What are the investment risks associated with the New Superannuation Scheme? 
o Investment risks include market volatility, interest rate changes, and economic factors 
that may affect fund performance. There is no capital guarantee for this scheme. 
28. Can I switch between different investment options? 
o Yes, you can switch between different fund option available with us. 12 free switches 
are allowed in a year. 
29. Do the Trust managed In-House? 
o Yes, Superannuation Trust scheme will be managed In -House i.e by TATA AIA Life 
Insurance Company Limited. 
30. Can I get a loan against my superannuation fund? 
o No, loans against the superannuation fund are not permitted under the scheme’s 
rules. 
31. Who should I contact for the New Superannuation Scheme?
